name: UpdateServiceCustomField
description:
Update a custom field for a PagerDuty service.

This tool updates a specified custom field for services in PagerDuty. It requires OAuth with `custom_fields.write` permission.

parameters.name: service_field_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the custom field to update in PagerDuty.

parameters.name: accept_header
parameters.description: Specifies the accepted response version for the API. Used for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The Content-Type header specifying the data format. Must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: custom_field_details
parameters.description: JSON object detailing the custom field to be updated, including description, display name, enabled status, and field options.

description.description: A description of the data this field contains.

display_name.description: The human-readable name of the field. This must be unique across an account.

field_options.description:
List of field options to update, insert or delete. This field supports several behaviors:
  - Empty array: Deletes all field options
  - Omitting the `field_options` array entirely: Preserves all existing options
  - Not listing an existing option: Deletes that option (unless it's the current default value)

field.description: Details of the custom field to be updated.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

description.description: A description of the data this field contains.

display_name.description: The human-readable name of the field. This must be unique across an account.

field_options.description:
List of field options to update, insert or delete. This field supports several behaviors:
  - Empty array: Deletes all field options
  - Omitting the `field_options` array entirely: Preserves all existing options
  - Not listing an existing option: Deletes that option (unless it's the current default value)

field.description: Details of the custom field to be updated.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
